decision_conditions: No samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building have been provided in regard to Condition 3 (Materials). Samples for all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building are required. As such, the applicant has failed to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Insufficient information has been provided in regard to Condition 5 (Sustainable Drainage) of the planning permission granted with Appeal Decision APP/Z5630/W/19/3240569, including a timetable for the implementation, and a management and maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development and the arrangements for adoption by any public body or statutory undertaker, or any other arrangements to secure the effective operation of the sustainable drainage system throughout its lifetime. As such, the applicant has failed to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with Policy CS1 (Climate Change Mitigation) of the Local Development Framework Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

By reason of the prominent position at the front of the application site, the proposed cycle storage would result in a discordant frontage within the street scene. The proposed cycle storage would appear incongruous within the street scene and would fail to respect, maintain or enhance the character of the area, contrary to the Kingston Residential Design SPD (2013), Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and the NPPF (2021).

Insufficient information has been provided in regard to Condition 9 (Landscaping scheme) of the planning permission granted with Appeal Decision APP/Z5630/W/19/3240569. The proposed landscaping scheme is insufficient for the purposes of discharging this condition, conflicting with Paragraph 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance set out in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD 2013.
